intro: Kochia melanocoma, commonly known as the blackleaf kochia, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the amaranth family (Amaranthaceae) and is characterized by its upright growth habit and distinctive, spiky seed heads. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in dense, spherical inflorescences. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and can range from green to reddish in color. Kochia melanocoma is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments.
